info.name: Emboliform nucleus
info.description: The emboliform nucleus is one of the deep nuclei of the cerebellum located medial to the dentate nucleus and lateral to the globose nucleus. In non-human species it is combined with the globose nucleus as a single nuclear mass and called the 'interposed' nucleus or 'nucleus interpositus'; this term is commonly used in human neuroanatomy as well. It receives input from the paravermal zone of cerebellar cortex and projects its output via the superior cerebellar peduncle to terminate in the ventral lateral nucleus of thalamus and the red nucleus.
info.item: /Sections/Thin, Whole Brain/Sagittal & Parasagittal/4 Sag Thin Sec
